question.qText: What is the main idea expressed in this excerpt from <font face='lc-Italic'>Two Treatises of Government</font>?

aBtn.aText: In a properly organized society, the government acts as an umpire to pass judgment when disputes between citizens occur.
Absolute monarchy can be a good form of government, if the king judges fairly in disputed matters.
Kings have the right to make laws without the consent of the people.
A good king should never stoop to follow the laws made for his subjects, since he is not bound by them.
In civil society, individuals have the right to pass judgment and punish wrongdoers.
